segment.source: How to Deploy the App-V Client
segment.target: How to Deploy the App-V Client

segment.source: How to Deploy the App-V Client
segment.target: How to Deploy the App-V Client

segment.source: How to Deploy the App-V Client
segment.target: How to Deploy the App-V Client

segment.source: Use the following procedure to install the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.1 client and Remote Desktop Services client.
segment.target: Use the following procedure to install the Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) 5.1 client and Remote Desktop Services client.

segment.source: You must install the version of the client that matches the operating system of the target computer.
segment.target: You must install the version of the client that matches the operating system of the target computer.

segment.source: What to do before you start
segment.target: What to do before you start

segment.source: Review and install the software prerequisites:
segment.target: Review and install the software prerequisites:

segment.source: Install the prerequisite software that corresponds to the version of App-V that you are installing:
segment.target: Install the prerequisite software that corresponds to the version of App-V that you are installing:

segment.source: Review the client coexistence and unsupported scenarios, as applicable to your installation:
segment.target: Review the client coexistence and unsupported scenarios, as applicable to your installation:

segment.source: Planning for the App-V 5.1 Sequencer and Client Deployment
segment.target: Planning for the App-V 5.1 Sequencer and Client Deployment

segment.source: See the client section in App-V 5.1 Supported Configurations
segment.target: See the client section in App-V 5.1 Supported Configurations

segment.source: Review the locations for client registry, log, and troubleshooting information:
segment.target: Review the locations for client registry, log, and troubleshooting information:

segment.source: By default, after you install the App-V 5.1 client, the client information is stored in the registry in the following registry key:
segment.target: By default, after you install the App-V 5.1 client, the client information is stored in the registry in the following registry key:

segment.source: When you deploy a virtualized package to a computer that is running the App-V client, the associated package data is stored in the following location:
segment.target: When you deploy a virtualized package to a computer that is running the App-V client, the associated package data is stored in the following location:

segment.source: However, you can reconfigure this location with the following registry key:
segment.target: However, you can reconfigure this location with the following registry key:

segment.source: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE \ SOFTWARE \ MICROSOFT \ SOFTWARE \ MICROSOFT \ APPV \ CLIENT \ STREAMING \ PACKAGEINSTALLATIONROOT
segment.target: HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE \ SOFTWARE \ MICROSOFT \ SOFTWARE \ MICROSOFT \ APPV \ CLIENT \ STREAMING \ PACKAGEINSTALLATIONROOT

segment.source: For log file information that is associated with the App-V 5.1 Client, search in the following log:
segment.target: For log file information that is associated with the App-V 5.1 Client, search in the following log:

segment.source: Event logs / Applications and Services Logs / Microsoft / AppV
segment.target: Event logs / Applications and Services Logs / Microsoft / AppV

segment.source: In App-V 5.0 SP3, some logs were consolidated and moved to the following location:
segment.target: In App-V 5.0 SP3, some logs were consolidated and moved to the following location:

segment.source: For a list of the moved logs, see About App-V 5.0 SP3.
segment.target: For a list of the moved logs, see About App-V 5.0 SP3.

segment.source: Packages that are currently stored on computers that run the App-V 5.1 Client are saved to the following location:
segment.target: Packages that are currently stored on computers that run the App-V 5.1 Client are saved to the following location:

segment.source: See the error log in the %temp% folder.
segment.target: See the error log in the %temp% folder.

segment.source: To review the log files, click Start, type %temp%, and then look for the appv_ log.
segment.target: To review the log files, click Start, type %temp%, and then look for the appv_ log.

segment.source: Copy the App-V 5.1 client installation file to the computer on which it will be installed.
segment.target: Copy the App-V 5.1 client installation file to the computer on which it will be installed.

segment.source: Choose from the following client types:
segment.target: Choose from the following client types:

segment.source: Remote Desktop Services version of the client
segment.target: Remote Desktop Services version of the client

segment.source: Double-click the installation file, and click Install.
segment.target: Double-click the installation file, and click Install.

segment.source: Before the installation begins, the installer checks the computer for any missing App-V 5.1 Prerequisites.
segment.target: Before the installation begins, the installer checks the computer for any missing App-V 5.1 Prerequisites.

segment.source: Review and accept the Software License Terms, choose whether to use Microsoft Update and whether to participate in the Microsoft Customer Experience Improvement Program, and click Install.
segment.target: Review and accept the Software License Terms, choose whether to use Microsoft Update and whether to participate in the Microsoft Customer Experience Improvement Program, and click Install.

segment.source: On the Setup completed successfully page, click Close.
segment.target: On the Setup completed successfully page, click Close.

segment.source: The installation creates the following entries for the App-V client in Programs:
segment.target: The installation creates the following entries for the App-V client in Programs:

segment.source: After the installation, only the .exe file can be uninstalled.
segment.target: After the installation, only the .exe file can be uninstalled.

segment.source: To install the App-V 5.1 client using a script
segment.target: To install the App-V 5.1 client using a script

segment.source: Install all of the required prerequisite software on the target computers.
segment.target: Install all of the required prerequisite software on the target computers.

segment.source: See What to do before you start.
segment.target: See What to do before you start.

segment.source: If you install the client by using an .msi file, the installation will fail if any prerequisites are missing.
segment.target: If you install the client by using an .msi file, the installation will fail if any prerequisites are missing.

segment.source: To use a script to install the App-V 5.1 client, use the following parameters with appvclientsetup.exe.
segment.target: To use a script to install the App-V 5.1 client, use the following parameters with appvclientsetup.exe.

segment.source: The client Windows Installer (.msi) supports the same set of switches, except for the /LOG parameter.
segment.target: The client Windows Installer (.msi) supports the same set of switches, except for the /LOG parameter.

segment.source: Enables participation in the Customer Experience Improvement Program.
segment.target: Enables participation in the Customer Experience Improvement Program.

segment.source: Specifies the directory in which to install all new applications and updates.
segment.target: Specifies the directory in which to install all new applications and updates.

segment.source: Overrides the source location for downloading package content.
segment.target: Overrides the source location for downloading package content.

segment.source: Specifies how new packages will be loaded by App-V 5.1 on a specific computer.
segment.target: Specifies how new packages will be loaded by App-V 5.1 on a specific computer.

segment.source: The following options are enabled: [1]; automatically load all packages [2]; or automatically load no packages [0].Example usage: /AUTOLOAD=[0|1|2]
segment.target: The following options are enabled: [1]; automatically load all packages [2]; or automatically load no packages [0].Example usage: /AUTOLOAD=[0|1|2]

segment.source: Specifies that streamed package contents will be not be saved to the local hard disk.
segment.target: Specifies that streamed package contents will be not be saved to the local hard disk.

segment.source: Allows the App-V 5.1 client to modify the shortcuts and FTAs that are associated with the packages that are created with a previous version.
segment.target: Allows the App-V 5.1 client to modify the shortcuts and FTAs that are associated with the packages that are created with a previous version.

segment.source: Enables the scripts that are defined in the package manifest file or configuration files that should run.
segment.target: Enables the scripts that are defined in the package manifest file or configuration files that should run.

segment.source: Specifies the registry paths that will not roam with a user profile.
segment.target: Specifies the registry paths that will not roam with a user profile.

segment.source: Specifies the file paths relative to %userprofile% that do not roam with a user's profile.
segment.target: Specifies the file paths relative to %userprofile% that do not roam with a user's profile.

segment.source: Displays the name of the publishing server.
segment.target: Displays the name of the publishing server.

segment.source: Displays the URL of the publishing server.
segment.target: Displays the URL of the publishing server.

segment.source: Initiates a global publishing refresh when a user logs on.
segment.target: Initiates a global publishing refresh when a user logs on.

segment.source: Specifies the publishing refresh interval, where 0 indicates do not periodically refresh.
segment.target: Specifies the publishing refresh interval, where 0 indicates do not periodically refresh.

segment.source: Initiates a user publishing refresh when a user logs on.
segment.target: Initiates a user publishing refresh when a user logs on.

segment.source: Specifies the publishing refresh interval, where 0 indicates do not periodically refresh.
segment.target: Specifies the publishing refresh interval, where 0 indicates do not periodically refresh.

segment.source: Specifies a location where the log information is saved.
segment.target: Specifies a location where the log information is saved.

segment.source: Prevents the computer from rebooting after the client installation.
segment.target: Prevents the computer from rebooting after the client installation.

segment.source: The parameter prevents the end-user computer from rebooting after each update is installed and lets you schedule the reboot at your convenience.
segment.target: The parameter prevents the end-user computer from rebooting after each update is installed and lets you schedule the reboot at your convenience.

segment.source: For example, you can install App-V 5.1 and then install Hotfix Package Y without rebooting after the Service Pack installation.
segment.target: For example, you can install App-V 5.1 and then install Hotfix Package Y without rebooting after the Service Pack installation.

segment.source: After the installation, you must reboot before you start using App-V.
segment.target: After the installation, you must reboot before you start using App-V.

segment.source: This is required for an unattended installation.
segment.target: This is required for an unattended installation.

segment.source: It also extracts the Windows Installer (.msi) and script files to a folder without installing App-V 5.1.
segment.target: It also extracts the Windows Installer (.msi) and script files to a folder without installing App-V 5.1.

segment.source: Requests help about the previous installation parameters.
segment.target: Requests help about the previous installation parameters.

segment.source: To install the App-V 5.1 client by using the Windows Installer (.msi) file
segment.target: To install the App-V 5.1 client by using the Windows Installer (.msi) file

segment.source: Install the required prerequisites on the target computers.
segment.target: Install the required prerequisites on the target computers.

segment.source: See What to do before you start.
segment.target: See What to do before you start.

segment.source: If any prerequisites are not met, the installation will fail.
segment.target: If any prerequisites are not met, the installation will fail.

segment.source: Ensure that the target computers do not have any pending restarts before you install the client using the App-V 5.1 Windows Installer (.msi) files.
segment.target: Ensure that the target computers do not have any pending restarts before you install the client using the App-V 5.1 Windows Installer (.msi) files.

segment.source: The Windows Installer files do not flag a pending restart.
segment.target: The Windows Installer files do not flag a pending restart.

segment.source: Deploy one of the following Windows Installer files to the target computer.
segment.target: Deploy one of the following Windows Installer files to the target computer.

segment.source: The file that you specify must match the configuration of the target computer.
segment.target: The file that you specify must match the configuration of the target computer.

segment.source: Computer is running a 32-bit Microsoft Windows operating system
segment.target: Computer is running a 32-bit Microsoft Windows operating system

segment.source: Computer is running a 64-bit Microsoft Windows operating system
segment.target: Computer is running a 64-bit Microsoft Windows operating system

segment.source: You are deploying the App-V 5.1 Remote Desktop Services client
segment.target: You are deploying the App-V 5.1 Remote Desktop Services client

segment.source: Using the information in the following table, select the appropriate language pack .msi to install, based on the desired language for the target computer.
segment.target: Using the information in the following table, select the appropriate language pack .msi to install, based on the desired language for the target computer.

segment.source: The xxxx in the table refers to the target locale of the language pack.
segment.target: The xxxx in the table refers to the target locale of the language pack.

segment.source: What to know before you start:
segment.target: What to know before you start:

segment.source: The language packs are common to both the standard App-V 5.1 client and the Remote Desktop Services version of the App-V 5.1 client.
segment.target: The language packs are common to both the standard App-V 5.1 client and the Remote Desktop Services version of the App-V 5.1 client.

segment.source: If you install the App-V 5.1 client using the .exe, the installer will deploy only the language pack that matches the operating system running on the target computer.
segment.target: If you install the App-V 5.1 client using the .exe, the installer will deploy only the language pack that matches the operating system running on the target computer.

segment.source: To deploy additional language packs on a target computer, use the procedure To install the App-V 5.1 client by using Windows Installer (.msi) file.
segment.target: To deploy additional language packs on a target computer, use the procedure To install the App-V 5.1 client by using Windows Installer (.msi) file.

segment.source: Computer is running a 32-bit Microsoft Windows operating system
segment.target: Computer is running a 32-bit Microsoft Windows operating system

segment.source: Computer is running a 64-bit Microsoft Windows operating system
segment.target: Computer is running a 64-bit Microsoft Windows operating system

segment.source: Add or vote on suggestions here.
segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.source: How to Uninstall the App-V 5.1 Client
segment.target: How to Uninstall the App-V 5.1 Client
